meaning: Perfectly clean, neat, or tidy.
sentence: His white shirt was immaculate.

meaning: Feeling or expressing remorse or penitence.
sentence: He looked contrite after breaking the vase.

meaning: To feel sincere regret or remorse about one's wrongdoing.
sentence: He repented for his harsh words.

meaning: Deep regret or guilt for a wrong committed.
sentence: She felt no remorse for her actions.

meaning: Lasting for a very short time.
sentence: Fame in the digital age is often ephemeral.

meaning: Perfectly clean, neat, or tidy; free from flaws or mistakes.
sentence: He wore an immaculate white suit to the party.

meaning: Feeling or expressing remorse or penitence; affected by guilt.
sentence: She was contrite the morning after her angry outburst.

meaning: To feel sincere regret or remorse about one's wrongdoing or sin.
sentence: He repented of his sins before he died.

meaning: Deep regret or guilt for a wrong committed.
sentence: He felt no remorse for the murders he had committed.

meaning: Feeling or showing sorrow and regret for having done wrong; a person who repents their sins.
sentence: The penitent husband spent hours apologizing to his wife.

meaning: Reparation for a wrong or injury.
sentence: He wanted to find a way to make atonement for his sins.

meaning: A feeling of guilt or moral scruple that follows the doing of something bad.
sentence: They used their political power without compunction.

meaning: To atone for (guilt or sin).
sentence: He tried to expiate his crimes by giving money to the church.

meaning: Not feeling shame or regret about one's actions or attitudes.
sentence: He was impenitent about his criminal past.

meaning: Characterized by a lack of shame; showing no shame.
sentence: She is a shameless self-promoter.

meaning: Irrelevant or unrelated to the subject being dealt with.
sentence: We do not want any extraneous information in the report.

meaning: Not connected with or relevant to something.
sentence: His comment was irrelevant to the discussion.

meaning: Unnecessary, especially through being more than enough.
sentence: The report was marred by a mass of superfluous detail.

meaning: Not or no longer needed or useful; superfluous.
sentence: Many of the old skills had become redundant.

meaning: Relevant or applicable to a particular matter.
sentence: She asked me a lot of very pertinent questions.

meaning: Relevant to a subject under consideration.
sentence: That is not germane to our theme.

meaning: With reference to; concerning. Very appropriate to a particular situation.
sentence: The song feels apropos to the midnight setting.

meaning: Apt in the circumstances or in relation to something.
sentence: He added an apposite quotation to his speech; it was perfect.

meaning: Equivalent in seriousness to; virtually the same as.
sentence: Her silence was tantamount to an admission of guilt.

meaning: Necessary to make a whole complete; essential or fundamental.
sentence: Vegetables are an integral part of our diet.

meaning: Absolutely necessary; extremely important.
sentence: Water is essential for life.

meaning: Of considerable importance, size, or worth.
sentence: He made a substantial donation to the charity.

meaning: Concise and exact use of words in writing or speech.
sentence: The brevity of the meeting was a relief to everyone.

meaning: Giving a lot of information clearly and in a few words.
sentence: Make your answers clear and concise.

meaning: Sparing in the use of words; abrupt.
sentence: He gave a terse reply to my question.

meaning: Using very few words.
sentence: His laconic reply suggested a lack of interest in the topic.

meaning: Containing or presenting the essential facts of something in a comprehensive but concise way.
sentence: It is a compendious study of the subject.

meaning: Using or containing too many words; tediously lengthy.
sentence: The author's prolix style makes the book difficult to read.

meaning: Using or expressed in more words than are needed.
sentence: His verbose explanation confused everyone.

meaning: The use of many words where fewer would do, especially in a deliberate attempt to be vague or evasive.
sentence: Politicians are experts in circumlocution.

meaning: A legacy; something left to someone in a will.
sentence: She received a generous bequest from her aunt.

meaning: A person's orders or command.
sentence: They attended the meeting at the behest of the director.

meaning: An official order issued by a legal authority.
sentence: The President issued a decree banning public gatherings.

meaning: Authoritatively or urgently call on (someone) to be present.
sentence: She was summoned to the principal's office.

meaning: A direction or order.
sentence: Read the instructions carefully before starting.

meaning: The freedom to decide what should be done in a particular situation.
sentence: I leave the decision to your discretion.

meaning: The faculty or power of using one's will.
sentence: She left the company of her own volition.

meaning: Small or meager.
sentence: She was paid a paltry sum for her hard work.

meaning: Lacking in quantity or quality.
sentence: He supplemented his meager income by working at night.

meaning: Of little importance; trivial.
sentence: They argued over petty grievances.

meaning: Of little value or importance.
sentence: Don't get angry over such trivial matters.

meaning: Unimportant or trivial.
sentence: It was a trifling matter that we easily ignored.

meaning: Too small or unimportant to be worth consideration.
sentence: The cost was insignificant compared to the benefits.

meaning: Without moral principles; ignoble.
sentence: His actions were motivated by base instincts.

meaning: A secret political clique or faction.
sentence: A cabal of dissidents plotted to overthrow the government.

meaning: A large crowd of people, especially one that is disorderly and intent on causing trouble or violence.
sentence: The angry mob marched towards the palace.

meaning: A small group of people with shared interests or tastes, especially one that is exclusive of other people.
sentence: A coterie of scientists met privately to discuss the findings.

meaning: A small organized dissenting group within a larger one, especially in politics.
sentence: The party split into rival factions.

meaning: A small group of people, with shared interests or other features in common, who spend time together and do not readily allow others to join them.
sentence: The popular kids formed a tight clique at school.

meaning: A connection or series of connections linking two or more things.
sentence: The nexus between industry and political power is strong.

meaning: Willingness to secretly allow or be involved in wrongdoing, especially an immoral or illegal act.
sentence: The crime was committed with the connivance of the security guards.

meaning: The process or fact of isolating or being isolated.
sentence: The patient was kept in isolation to prevent the spread of infection.

meaning: Intended to prevent disease.
sentence: Vaccines are prophylactic measures against diseases.

meaning: Designed to keep something undesirable such as illness or harm from occurring.
sentence: Preventive maintenance can save money in the long run.

meaning: Carried out as a precaution; preventive.
sentence: He took precautionary measures to secure his home.

meaning: Care taken to avoid danger or mistakes.
sentence: Proceed with caution when driving on icy roads.

meaning: A medicine or treatment for a disease or injury.
sentence: There is no known remedy for this disease.

meaning: The action of putting someone or something at risk or in danger.
sentence: Child endangerment is a serious crime.

meaning: An agreement.
sentence: The international covenant on human rights was signed by many nations.

meaning: A formally concluded and ratified agreement between countries.
sentence: The two countries signed a peace treaty.

meaning: A formal agreement between individuals or parties.
sentence: They made a pact to always stay friends.

meaning: A union or association formed for mutual benefit, especially between countries or organizations.
sentence: The two parties formed a strategic alliance.

meaning: An agreement between enemies or opponents to stop fighting or arguing for a certain time.
sentence: The rebels declared a temporary truce.

meaning: The official procedure or system of rules governing affairs of state or diplomatic occasions.
sentence: It is against protocol for the Prince to do that.

meaning: Give or grant someone (power, status, or recognition). agreement or harmony.
sentence: His views are in accord with public opinion.

meaning: Having a red or flushed complexion; elaborately or excessively intricate or complicated.
sentence: His writing style is too florid for my taste.

meaning: Made in an intricate shape or decorated with complex patterns.
sentence: The room was filled with ornate furniture.

meaning: Extravagantly bright or showy, typically so as to be tasteless.
sentence: She wore a gaudy costume to the party.

meaning: Ostentatiously attractive or impressive.
sentence: He drives a flashy sports car.

meaning: Very vivid in color, especially so as to create an unpleasantly harsh or unnatural effect.
sentence: The papers were full of lurid details of the murder.

meaning: Relating to or denoting a style of European architecture, music, and art of the 17th and 18th centuries that followed mannerism and is characterized by ornate detail.
sentence: The church is a masterpiece of Baroque architecture.

meaning: Obtrusively bright and showy; lurid.
sentence: The room was painted in garish colors.

meaning: Furiously angry.
sentence: He was livid when he found out the truth.

meaning: Not adorned; plain.
sentence: The walls were unadorned and white.

meaning: Not clothed or covered.
sentence: The cupboard was bare.

meaning: Read (something), typically in a thorough or careful way.
sentence: She perused the document carefully.

meaning: Examine or inspect closely and thoroughly.
sentence: The police scrutinized the evidence extensively.

meaning: Physically explore or examine something with the hands or an instrument.
sentence: Journalists probed into his private life.

meaning: Accept and allow (behavior that is considered morally wrong or offensive) to continue.
sentence: The college cannot condone any behavior that involves illicit drugs.

meaning: Pay no attention to; ignore.
sentence: Please disregard the previous email.

meaning: Inflicting or intended as punishment.
sentence: The US imposed punitive tariffs on imports.

meaning: Relating to punishment of offenders under the legal system.
sentence: The penal system needs reform.

meaning: Punishment inflicted on someone as vengeance for a wrong or criminal act.
sentence: He feared retribution from his enemies.

meaning: Make an attack or assault in return for a similar attack.

sentence: The army retaliated with an air strike.

meaning: The inescapable agent of someone's or something's downfall.

meaning: Reprimand (someone) severely.

meaning: Show or declare that (someone) is not guilty of wrongdoing.
sentence: The article exculpated the mayor.

meaning: Absolve (someone) from blame for a fault or wrongdoing.
sentence: The report exonerated the crew from all blame.

meaning: Denoting a sin that is not regarded as depriving the soul of divine grace. (of a fault or offense) slight and pardonable.
sentence: A venial sin is easily forgiven.

meaning: Showing or motivated by susceptibility to bribery.
sentence: The judge was known to be venal and easily bribed.

meaning: An official pardon for people who have been convicted of political offenses.
sentence: The government declared an amnesty for political prisoners.

meaning: Destroy utterly; wipe out.
sentence: The city was obliterated by the bomb.

meaning: Destroy utterly; obliterate.

meaning: Destroy completely.

meaning: Root out and destroy completely.
sentence: The use of torture must be extirpated.

meaning: Cause severe and extensive damage to.

meaning: (of an animal or force of nature) fierce, violent, and uncontrolled.
sentence: He was the victim of a savage attack.

meaning: Destroy completely; put an end to.

meaning: Restore to life or consciousness.
sentence: The doctors managed to revive him.

meaning: Holding firmly to an opinion or a course of action.
sentence: She was pertinacious in her demands.

meaning: Stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion or chosen course of action.

meaning: Stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion or course of action.
sentence: The president remained obdurate on the issue of tax cuts.

meaning: Resolutely or dutifully firm and unwavering.

meaning: Tending to keep a firm hold of something; clinging or adhering closely.
sentence: He is a tenacious opponent.

meaning: Stupidly obstinate.

meaning: Impossible to stop or prevent.

meaning: Having or showing a stubborn and determined intention to do as one wants, regardless of the consequences.

meaning: Self-willed and obstinate.

meaning: Cease developing; be stagnant or rigid.

meaning: Haughty and stubborn.

meaning: Having an obstinately uncooperative attitude toward authority or discipline.

meaning: Not showing fear or hesitation in the face of danger or difficulty.

meaning: Ready to accept control or instruction; submissive.

meaning: Ready to conform to the authority or will of others; meekly obedient or passive.

meaning: Easily bent; flexible.

meaning: Willing to please others; obliging; agreeable.

meaning: (of a substance or object) giving way under pressure; not hard or rigid.

meaning: Prepared to obey others unquestioningly.

meaning: Complying or willing to comply with orders or requests; submissive to another's will.

meaning: Huge.

meaning: A difficult or unpleasant situation.

meaning: One's opponent in a contest, conflict, or dispute.

meaning: Gather together or acquire an increasing number or quantity of.

meaning: Gather or collect (something, especially information or approval).

meaning: Take in and understand fully (information or ideas); absorb and integrate.

meaning: Waste time, money, or energy on trifling matters.

meaning: (of a country or region) having the freedom to govern itself or control its own affairs.
sentence: The university is an autonomous institution.

meaning: A change of circumstances or fortune, typically one that is unwelcome or unpleasant.

meaning: A slight change in position, direction, or tendency.

meaning: The state of being stable.

meaning: The quality of being faithful and dependable.

meaning: Show or prove to be right or reasonable.

meaning: Check or prove the validity or accuracy of (something).

meaning: Publicly recommend or support.

meaning: Having or revealing natural creative skill.

meaning: Without guile or deception; natural and simple.

meaning: (of a task, problem, or situation) requiring care and skill because difficult or awkward.

meaning: Proceeding in a gradual, subtle way, but with harmful effects.

meaning: Having or showing a cunning and deceitful nature.

meaning: Acting or done in a secret or dishonest way.

meaning: Given to or involved in making secret and underhanded plans.

meaning: Arousing one's curiosity or interest; fascinating.

meaning: Having or showing sharp powers of judgment.

meaning: Having or showing an ability to accurately assess situations or people and turn this to one's advantage.

meaning: Relating to a fox or foxes; cunning or crafty.

meaning: Furtive; sly.

meaning: Having or showing shrewdness and good judgment, especially in money or business matters.

meaning: (of a person or action) showing a lack of experience, wisdom, or judgment.

meaning: Easily persuaded to believe something; credulous.

meaning: Having or showing too great a readiness to believe things.

meaning: The consequences or aftereffects of a significant unpleasant event.

meaning: A result or effect of an action or condition.

meaning: A proposition that follows from (and is often appended to) one already proved.

meaning: A consequence of an action or event, especially when complex or unwelcome.

meaning: The action of one object coming forcibly into contact with another; marked effect or influence.

meaning: The adverse side effects or results of a situation.

meaning: The final or eventual outcome or conclusion of a discussion, action, or series of events.

meaning: An unintended consequence occurring some time after an event or action, especially an unwelcome one.
sentence: His resignation will have serious repercussions.

meaning: A strong and adverse reaction by a large number of people, especially to a social or political development.
sentence: The government faced a backlash over the new tax.

meaning: Prolongation of a sound; resonance. Also, a continuing effect.
sentence: The reverberation of the explosion was felt miles away.

meaning: Something that takes place after or as a result of an earlier event.
sentence: The movie sequel was better than the original.

meaning: The arrival of a notable person, thing, or event.
sentence: The advent of the internet changed everything.

meaning: Come near or nearer to (someone or something) in distance or time.
sentence: Winter is approaching fast.

meaning: The process of coming into view or becoming exposed after being concealed.
sentence: The emergence of new leaders gave hope to the party.

meaning: The first appearance of light in the sky before sunrise; the beginning of a phenomenon.
sentence: We woke up at dawn to start our journey.

meaning: The beginning of something, especially something unpleasant.
sentence: The onset of winter brought heavy snow.

meaning: The start or beginning of something.
sentence: He made it clear from the outset that he wouldn't stay long.

meaning: The establishment or starting point of an institution or activity.
sentence: She has been with the company since its inception.

meaning: The origin or mode of formation of something.
sentence: The genesis of the idea occurred during a walk.

meaning: Begin; start.
sentence: The ceremony will commence at noon.

meaning: Begin and seem likely to continue (of something unpleasant or unwelcome).
sentence: Panic began to set in as the water rose.

meaning: A mass departure of people, especially emigrants.
sentence: There was a mass exodus from the city before the hurricane.

meaning: The action of leaving, typically to start a journey.
sentence: His sudden departure surprised everyone.

meaning: Bring to an end.
sentence: The contract was terminated early.

meaning: In a state or period of inactivity or dormancy.
sentence: The volcano has been quiescent for centuries.

meaning: Affected by lethargy; sluggish and apathetic.
sentence: He felt lethargic after the big meal.

meaning: (of a person) avoiding work; lazy. Also, not active or in use.
sentence: The machines stood idle during the strike.

meaning: An image or representation of a god used as an object of worship.
sentence: The pop star is an idol to millions of teenagers.

meaning: Mentally or physically inactive; lethargic.
sentence: The heat made the workers torpid.

meaning: Having normal physical functions suspended or slowed down for a period of time; in or as if in a deep sleep.
sentence: The volcano has been dormant for 500 years.

meaning: Lacking energy or enthusiasm.
sentence: She had a listless handshake.

meaning: Lacking enthusiasm and determination; carelessly lazy.
sentence: He has a lackadaisical attitude towards his studies.

meaning: Displaying or having a disinclination for physical exertion or effort; slow and relaxed.
sentence: They enjoyed a languid afternoon by the pool.

meaning: Wanting to avoid activity or exertion; lazy.
sentence: The indolent employee was fired.

meaning: A tendency to do nothing or to remain unchanged.
sentence: Bureaucratic inertia delayed the project.

meaning: Sleeping.
sentence: The slumbering giant awoke.

meaning: Accepting or allowing what happens or what others do, without active response or resistance.
sentence: He played a passive role in the relationship.

meaning: Of or in a state of deep unconsciousness for a prolonged or indefinite period.
sentence: The accident left him comatose for weeks.

meaning: Lying face upward. Also failing to act or protest as a result of moral weakness or indolence.
sentence: He lay supine on the beach.

meaning: Sleepy; drowsy.
sentence: The heavy meal made him feel somnolent.

meaning: Tending to induce drowsiness or sleep.
sentence: The professor's lecture was soporific.

meaning: Showing great care and perseverance.
sentence: She was assiduous in her duties.

meaning: Requiring or using great exertion.
sentence: The hike was very strenuous.

meaning: Involving or requiring strenuous effort; difficult and tiring.
sentence: It was an arduous journey across the mountains.

meaning: Having or showing care and conscientiousness in one's work or duties.
sentence: A diligent student always does their homework.

meaning: (of an argument or case) clear, logical, and convincing.
sentence: She presented a cogent argument for the policy change.

meaning: Involving hard or tedious work.
sentence: Farming in those days was toilsome work.

meaning: Great care or trouble taken to accomplish something.
sentence: She took great pains to dress well.

meaning: (of a person or action) showing dedication and diligence.
sentence: He watched her with sedulous care.

meaning: (especially of a task, process, or journey) requiring considerable effort and time.
sentence: Writing the book was a laborious process.

meaning: Requiring great strength or effort.
sentence: Moving the piano was a Herculean task.

meaning: An urgent need or demand.
sentence: The exigencies of war forced them to leave.

meaning: Very small in size or amount.
sentence: He managed to survive on an exiguous income.

meaning: The presence of something only in small or insufficient quantities or amounts; scarcity.
sentence: There is a paucity of information on the subject.

meaning: Small or insufficient in quantity or amount.
sentence: The evidence against him was scanty.

meaning: Thinly dispersed or scattered.
sentence: The population is sparse in the desert.

meaning: Entirely lacking or free from.
sentence: His voice was devoid of emotion.

meaning: A large or excessive amount of (something).
sentence: There is a plethora of books on the subject.

meaning: In abundance.
sentence: There were bargains galore at the sale.

meaning: Unusually or disproportionately large; excessive.
sentence: He spends an inordinate amount of time on games.

meaning: An excessive amount of something.
sentence: A surfeit of food made him feel sick.

meaning: A countless or extremely great number.
sentence: There are myriad stars in the sky.

meaning: Indefinitely many; a lot of.
sentence: I have told you umpteen times to clean your room.

meaning: (especially of something unwelcome or unpleasant) flourishing or spreading unchecked.
sentence: Corruption was rampant in the country.

meaning: Form branches or offshoots; spread or branch out.
sentence: The problem ramified into many complex issues.

meaning: Ostentatiously rich and luxurious or lavish.
sentence: They lived in an opulent mansion.

meaning: Exuberantly plentiful; abundant.
sentence: He offered profuse apologies for the mistake.

meaning: Abundant in supply or quantity.
sentence: She took copious notes during the lecture.

meaning: A severe flood. Also, a great quantity of something arriving at the same time.
sentence: We received a deluge of complaints.

meaning: Impose a misleading belief upon (someone); deceive; fool.
sentence: Don't let him delude you with false promises.

meaning: (of countryside) green with grass or other rich vegetation.
sentence: The hills were verdant after the rain.

meaning: (of vegetation) growing luxuriantly.
sentence: The valley was full of lush vegetation.

meaning: Enjoy oneself in a luxurious way; take self-indulgent delight.
sentence: She luxuriated in a warm bubble bath.

meaning: (of clothing or drapery) loose and ample. Also, (of writing) very lengthy and full.
sentence: He wrote voluminous notes on the subject.

meaning: Behavior, speech, or writing that is artificial and designed to impress.
sentence: His British accent is just an affectation.

meaning: A gentle feeling of fondness or liking.
sentence: She has deep affection for her parents.

meaning: Stylishly luxurious and expensive.
sentence: They went to a swanky restaurant for dinner.

meaning: Display (something) ostentatiously, especially in order to provoke envy or admiration.
sentence: She likes to flaunt her wealth.

meaning: A thing that is not what it is purported to be.
sentence: Their marriage was a sham.

meaning: An attempt to make something that is not the case appear true.
sentence: He made a pretense of being busy.

meaning: The use of fallacious arguments, especially with the intention of deceiving.
sentence: He used political sophistry to win the debate.

meaning: Pretentious and vulgar display, especially of wealth and luxury, intended to impress or attract notice.
sentence: The house was furnished without ostentation.

meaning: Conformity to facts; accuracy.
sentence: Officials questioned the veracity of his statement.

meaning: (typically of a woman) pleasant to look at; attractive.
sentence: She is a comely young woman.

meaning: Physically beautiful (often used humorously).
sentence: The movie star was described as pulchritudinous.

meaning: Ugly or disgusting to look at.
sentence: The monster had a hideous face.

meaning: Causing great horror or fear; frightful or macabre.
sentence: It was a ghastly crime scene.

meaning: Excessive admiration or praise.
sentence: The actor enjoyed the adulation of his fans.

meaning: The action of making something poorer in quality by adding another substance, typically an inferior one.
sentence: The adulteration of milk is a crime.

meaning: Obedient or attentive to an excessive or servile degree.
sentence: The waiter was obsequious to the rich customers.

meaning: Persuade (someone) gradually or by flattery to do something.
sentence: She tried to coax the cat out of the tree.

meaning: Obsequious behavior toward someone important in order to gain advantage.
sentence: His promotion was due to sycophancy, not merit.

meaning: Displaying exaggerated flattery or affection; obsequious.
sentence: The fawning audience laughed at every joke.

meaning: Coax (someone) with kind words or flattery.
sentence: He tried to blandish her into accepting the offer.

meaning: Employ endearments or flattery to persuade someone to do something or give one something.
sentence: She wheedled some money out of her father.

meaning: Behaving in an excessively obedient or servile way as a means of gaining favor.
sentence: I hate his constant bootlicking of the boss.

meaning: A person who behaves obsequiously to someone important.
sentence: Nobody likes a toady.

meaning: Bring oneself into favor with someone by flattering or trying to please them.
sentence: He tried to ingratiate himself with the new manager.

meaning: Scold or rebuke.
sentence: She chided him for his bad manners.

meaning: Scold or criticize (someone) angrily.
sentence: The coach berated the players for their poor performance.

meaning: An attack on the reputation or integrity of someone or something.
sentence: He cast aspersions on her character.

meaning: Find fault with (someone); scold.
sentence: She upbraided him for being late.

meaning: Address (someone) in such a way as to express disapproval or disappointment.
sentence: Her eyes were full of reproach.

meaning: Harsh criticism or censure.
sentence: His actions brought opprobrium upon the family.

meaning: Trouble or annoy (someone) with frequent or persistent requests or interruptions.
sentence: The kids pestered him for ice cream.

meaning: Make (someone) feel annoyed, frustrated, or worried, especially with trivial matters.
sentence: The question seemed to vex him.

meaning: Irritate or annoy (someone).
sentence: Her comments really nettled him.

meaning: Ask (someone) repeatedly and annoyingly for something; pester.
sentence: She badgered her parents to buy her a car.

meaning: Put in a very difficult situation. Also, lay siege to.
sentence: The beleaguered prime minister faced calls to resign.

meaning: Subject (someone) to hostility and ill-treatment, especially because of their race or political or religious beliefs.
sentence: Minorities were persecuted by the regime.

meaning: (of a comment, event, or fact) cause annoyance or resentment that persists.
sentence: The insult continued to rankle him for days.

meaning: An annoying person, especially one who provokes others into action by criticism.
sentence: He is a political gadfly who challenges the mayor constantly.

meaning: Tease. Also, the husks of corn or other seed separated by winnowing or threshing.
sentence: The boys chaffed him about his new haircut.

meaning: Ask someone earnestly or anxiously to do something.
sentence: I entreat you to help me.

meaning: Beg someone earnestly or desperately to do something.
sentence: She implored him not to leave.

meaning: Harass (someone) persistently for or to do something.
sentence: He importuned the editor for a job.

meaning: Ask (someone) urgently and fervently to do something; implore.
sentence: I beseech you to show mercy.

meaning: Ask or beg for something earnestly or humbly.
sentence: They supplicated the king for pardon.

meaning: Ask for or try to obtain (something) from someone.
sentence: The charity is soliciting donations.

meaning: Make a forcefully reproachful protest.
sentence: He went to the manager to remonstrate against the new rules.

meaning: (of part of the body) soft and hanging loosely or limply, especially so as to look or feel unpleasant.
sentence: His muscles became flaccid after months of inactivity.

meaning: Drained of energy or vitality.
sentence: The hot sun enervated the hikers.

meaning: Insubstantial and easily damaged.
sentence: The evidence was too flimsy to convict him.

meaning: Deprived of strength or power; debilitated.
sentence: He was incapacitated by the accident.

meaning: (of a person) weak and delicate.
sentence: She looked old and frail.

meaning: Trembling or tottering, typically because of old age.
sentence: The doddering old man needed help crossing the street.

meaning: Strong and healthy; vigorous.
sentence: He is in robust health.

meaning: (of a person, animal, or thing) able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions.
sentence: Children are often more resilient than adults.

meaning: Practicing or affecting strict religious or moral behavior.
sentence: His puritanical views made him unpopular.

meaning: Strictly honorable or honest. Also, vertical or erect.
sentence: He was an upright citizen.

meaning: Anxious or angry in a tense and overly controlled way.
sentence: Don't get so uptight about small things.

meaning: Having or showing high moral standards.
sentence: She led a virtuous life.

meaning: Diligent, thorough, and extremely attentive to details. Also, concerned to avoid doing wrong.
sentence: He was scrupulous in his business dealings.

meaning: Having or showing no moral principles; not honest or fair.
sentence: The unscrupulous salesman tricked the elderly couple.

meaning: An inner feeling or voice viewed as acting as a guide to the rightness or wrongness of one's behavior.
sentence: His conscience bothered him after he lied.

meaning: A qualification to an expression of agreement or approval; a doubt.
sentence: I have some reservations about the plan.

meaning: A stupid person.
sentence: Don't act like an imbecile.

meaning: Extremely stupid or foolish.
sentence: That was an asinine comment.

meaning: Silly and pointless.
sentence: He made a fatuous remark.

meaning: A person who is slow at learning; a stupid person.
sentence: He was the class dunce.

meaning: A foolish or stupid person.
sentence: Only a nincompoop would believe that.

meaning: A foolish or gullible person (Likely meant 'Simpleton').
sentence: He is a simplet who believes everything.

meaning: An ignorant or stupid person.
sentence: He is a complete ignoramus when it comes to technology.

meaning: Annoyingly insensitive or slow to understand.
sentence: Are you being deliberately obtuse?

meaning: A stupid, uncultured, or clumsy person.
sentence: Watch where you're going, you clumsy oaf!

meaning: Lacking sensitivity, refinement, or intelligence.
sentence: It was a crass remark to make.

meaning: A stupid person.
sentence: He's such a dolt, he forgot his own birthday.

meaning: A stupid or foolish person.
sentence: Use your brain, you numbskull!

meaning: A stupid person.
sentence: Listen to me, you blockhead!

meaning: Having or showing a perceptive understanding or insight; shrewd. Also, (of a bad situation) severe.
sentence: She has an acute mind.

meaning: The ability to make good judgments and quick decisions, typically in a particular domain.
sentence: He has remarkable business acumen.

meaning: Wise, or attempting to appear wise.
sentence: The sapient old man gave good advice.

meaning: Having the experience and knowledge necessary to deal with the potential difficulties or dangers of life in an urban environment.
sentence: You need to be street-smart to survive here.

meaning: A book or set of books giving information on many subjects or on many aspects of one subject.
sentence: He is a walking encyclopedia of sports trivia.

meaning: Not telling the truth; lying.
sentence: That was a mendacious statement.

meaning: Based on a mistaken belief.
sentence: His argument was based on fallacious reasoning.

meaning: Invent or concoct (something), typically with deceitful intent.
sentence: He fabricated a story to explain his absence.

meaning: Superficially plausible, but actually wrong.
sentence: It was a specious argument.

meaning: A dishonest or unprincipled man.
sentence: He is a charming rogue.

meaning: Sly or cunning intelligence.
sentence: He used guile to get what he wanted.

meaning: A person who pretends to be someone else in order to deceive others.
sentence: The doctor turned out to be an imposter.

meaning: The offense of willfully telling an untruth in a court after having taken an oath or affirmation.
sentence: He was convicted of perjury.

meaning: A person who dishonestly claims to have special knowledge and skill in some field, typically in medicine.
sentence: Don't trust that quack with your health.

meaning: The use of trickery to achieve a political, financial, or legal purpose.
sentence: He resorted to chicanery to win the election.

meaning: A person who deceives others, especially in order to trick them out of their money; a charlatan.
sentence: The mountebank sold fake cures to the villagers.

meaning: Exceedingly idealistic; unrealistic and impractical.
sentence: It was a quixotic attempt to change the world overnight.

meaning: An experience involving the apparent perception of something not present.
sentence: He was suffering from hallucinations.

meaning: An imagined place or state of things in which everything is perfect.
sentence: The idea of a utopia is unrealistic.

meaning: (of a mythical animal) formed from parts of various animals. Also, hoped for but illusory or impossible to achieve.
sentence: His plans for wealth were purely chimerical.

meaning: Waste (something, especially money or time) in a reckless and foolish manner.
sentence: He squandered his inheritance on gambling.

meaning: Disappear or cause to disappear. Also, squander or fritter away (money, energy, or resources).
sentence: The fog began to dissipate.

meaning: Spread (something, especially information) widely.
sentence: The internet allows us to disseminate information quickly.

meaning: Relating or devoted to that which is not sacred or biblical; secular rather than religious. Also, to treat (something sacred) with irreverence.
sentence: He used profane language in church.

meaning: Make (something bad or unsatisfactory) better.
sentence: Steps were taken to ameliorate the situation.

meaning: Give new and improved form, structure, or appearance to.
sentence: The company decided to revamp its image.

meaning: Put (something) right; correct.
sentence: Please rectify the error immediately.

meaning: Sign or give formal consent to (a treaty, contract, or agreement), making it officially valid.
sentence: The treaty was ratified by all countries.

meaning: Take apart (a piece of machinery or equipment) in order to examine it and repair it if necessary.
sentence: The engine needs a complete overhaul.

meaning: Make (a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling) worse.
sentence: The new law only exacerbated the problem.

meaning: Self-confidence or assurance, especially when in a demanding situation.
sentence: He handled the crisis with great aplomb.

meaning: Mental calmness, composure, and evenness of temper, especially in a difficult situation.
sentence: She accepted the bad news with equanimity.

meaning: Composure or coolness, sometimes excessive, as shown in danger or under trying circumstances.
sentence: He displayed remarkable sangfroid during the fire.

meaning: (of a person) having an unemotional and stolidly calm disposition.
sentence: He is a phlegmatic character who rarely gets angry.

meaning: Resulting in good; favorable or advantageous.
sentence: Regular exercise is beneficial to health.

meaning: A person who derives advantage from something, especially a trust, will, or life insurance policy.
sentence: She is the sole beneficiary of his will.

meaning: Health-giving; healthy. Also, (of a place) pleasant; not run-down.
sentence: The mountain air is very salubrious.

meaning: (especially with reference to something unwelcome or unpleasant) producing good effects; beneficial.
sentence: The accident was a salutary lesson in road safety.

meaning: Producing a great deal of profit.
sentence: It was a lucrative business deal.

meaning: (of a time) well-chosen or particularly favorable; appropriate.
sentence: He arrived at an opportune moment.

meaning: Not harmful or offensive.
sentence: It was an innocuous remark.

meaning: Conducive to or suggestive of good health and physical well-being.
sentence: She cooks wholesome meals for her family.

meaning: Harmful, poisonous, or very unpleasant.
sentence: Noxious fumes filled the room.

meaning: Tending to cause harm.
sentence: Smoking is detrimental to your health.

meaning: A cause of great distress or annoyance.
sentence: Mosquitoes are the bane of my existence.

meaning: Threatening harm; menacing.
sentence: He gave me a baleful look.

meaning: Having an extremely offensive smell.
sentence: A noisome stench came from the sewer.

meaning: Full of danger or risk.
sentence: It was a perilous journey.

meaning: Risky; dangerous.
sentence: These chemicals are hazardous to health.

meaning: Dangerous; perilous.
sentence: It was a jeopardous undertaking.

meaning: Suggesting the presence of danger; threatening.
sentence: Dark clouds gathered in a menacing way.

meaning: Sufficient to cause death.
sentence: The snake's venom is lethal.

meaning: Having a harmful effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way.
sentence: The pernicious effects of smoking are well known.

meaning: Tending to obstruct or harm. Also, unfriendly; hostile.
sentence: These policies are inimical to growth.

meaning: Causing harm or damage.
sentence: Pollution has a deleterious effect on the environment.

meaning: Of or belonging to the time before the biblical Flood. Also, ridiculously old-fashioned.
sentence: His ideas are antediluvian.

meaning: Inhabiting or existing in a land from the earliest times or from before the arrival of colonists.
sentence: We studied the aboriginal art of Australia.

meaning: In its original condition; unspoiled. Also, clean and fresh as if new.
sentence: The beach was in pristine condition.

meaning: Of or resembling the earliest ages in the history of the world.
sentence: The forest looked primeval.

meaning: Very old or old-fashioned.
sentence: The law is archaic and needs to be updated.

meaning: No longer produced or used; out of date.
sentence: Typewriters are now largely obsolete.

meaning: Grayish white; old and trite.
sentence: He told a hoary old joke.

meaning: Of no value or importance.
sentence: The observation was nugatory.

meaning: Not able to produce children or young. Also, free from bacteria or other living microorganisms.
sentence: The needle must be sterile.

meaning: (of land or a climate) having little or no rain; too dry or barren to support vegetation.
sentence: The desert is an arid region.

meaning: Dried out with heat. Also, extremely thirsty.
sentence: The land was parched by the drought.

meaning: Not producing offspring or fruit; sterile.
sentence: The soil was infecund and unsuitable for farming.

meaning: Incapable of producing any useful result; pointless.
sentence: It was a futile attempt to escape.

meaning: Assertive of authority in an annoyingly domineering way, especially with regard to petty or trivial matters.
sentence: An officious security guard stopped us.

meaning: Conceitedly assertive and dogmatic in one's opinions.
sentence: He is too opinionated to listen to others.

meaning: Inclined to lay down principles as incontrovertibly true.
sentence: He is very dogmatic about his political views.

meaning: Unpleasantly domineering; trying to control other people's behavior and attitudes.
sentence: She has an overbearing mother.

meaning: Using power or authority without considering the feelings of others.
sentence: The manager's high-handed manner alienated the staff.

meaning: (especially of a person's manner or actions) insisting on immediate attention or obedience.
sentence: He spoke in a peremptory tone.

meaning: (of a person) easy to control or influence.
sentence: The children were tractable and well-behaved.

meaning: Quiet, gentle, and easily imposed on; submissive.
sentence: She was as meek as a lamb.

meaning: Inclined to agree with others or obey rules, especially to an excessive degree.
sentence: He was compliant with all the rules.

meaning: (of a person or manner) feeling or appearing casually calm and relaxed.
sentence: He was surprisingly nonchalant about winning the award.

meaning: Having no particular interest or sympathy; unconcerned.
sentence: He was indifferent to their suffering.

meaning: Showing or feeling no interest, enthusiasm, or concern.
sentence: The students were apathetic about the upcoming election.

meaning: A person who can endure pain or hardship without showing their feelings or complaining.
sentence: He remained stoic despite the bad news.

meaning: (of a person) calm, dependable, and showing little emotion or animation.
sentence: The stolid security guard refused to smile.

meaning: Not feeling or showing emotion.
sentence: She kept her face impassive during the interrogation.

meaning: Showing little enthusiasm. Also, (of liquid) only moderately warm.
sentence: The proposal received a lukewarm response.

meaning: (of an action or gesture) carried out with a minimum of effort or reflection.
sentence: He gave a perfunctory nod as he passed.

meaning: Intended for or likely to be understood by only a small number of people with a specialized knowledge or interest.
sentence: He enjoys reading esoteric philosophy books.

meaning: Difficult to understand; obscure.
sentence: The professor's lecture was too abstruse for the students.

meaning: Unable to speak distinctly or express oneself clearly.
sentence: He becomes inarticulate when he is angry.

meaning: (of language) open to more than one interpretation; having a double meaning.
sentence: The ending of the movie was ambiguous.

meaning: Having a meaning that is mysterious or obscure.
sentence: She sent me a cryptic message.

meaning: Open to more than one interpretation; ambiguous.
sentence: His answer was equivocal, leaving us confused.

meaning: In the form of a cloud or haze; hazy. Also, (of a concept or idea) unclear, vague, or ill-defined.
sentence: He has a nebulous idea of what he wants to do.

meaning: Able to be understood; comprehensible.
sentence: His speech was barely intelligible.

meaning: Of uncertain, indefinite, or unclear character or meaning.
sentence: She gave a vague answer.

meaning: Not discovered or known about; uncertain. Also, not clearly expressed or easily understood.
sentence: The details of his life remain obscure.

meaning: Swollen and distended or congested. Also, (of language or style) tediously pompous or bombastic.
sentence: His writing style is turgid and boring.

meaning: (of a liquid) cloudy, opaque, or thick with suspended matter.
sentence: The river water was brown and turbid.

meaning: Able to be understood; intelligible.
sentence: The instructions were easily comprehensible.

meaning: (of a liquid) free of anything that darkens; completely clear.
sentence: She looked into his limpid blue eyes.

meaning: Expressed clearly; easy to understand. Also, showing ability to think clearly.
sentence: He gave a lucid explanation of the complex theory.

meaning: Clearly expressed and easily understood; lucid.
sentence: His perspicuous arguments convinced the jury.

meaning: Translucently clear.
sentence: The water in the mountain stream was pellucid.

meaning: Stated clearly and in detail, leaving no room for confusion or doubt.
sentence: I gave you explicit instructions not to touch anything.

meaning: A person who has been taken prisoner or an animal that has been confined.
sentence: The soldiers were held captive for months.

meaning: The condition of being imprisoned or confined.
sentence: Animals bred in captivity often cannot survive in the wild.

meaning: Attract and hold the interest and attention of; charm.
sentence: She was captivated by his story.

meaning: The state of being a slave.
sentence: They were kept in bondage for years.

meaning: The state of being confined in prison; imprisonment.
sentence: His incarceration lasted ten years.

meaning: The action of confining, or the state of being confined.
sentence: He was placed in solitary confinement.

meaning: The state of being a serf or feudal laborer.
sentence: The peasants lived in a state of serfdom.

meaning: The act of seizing and holding legal custody of something.
sentence: The impoundment of the vehicle was ordered by the court.

meaning: The state of being confined as a prisoner, especially for political or military reasons.
sentence: During the war, many citizens faced internment.

meaning: A person seized or held as security for the fulfillment of a condition.
sentence: The terrorists held him hostage for three days.

meaning: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because illicit.
sentence: They had a clandestine meeting in the park.

meaning: Kept secret, especially because it would not be approved of.
sentence: She took a surreptitious glance at her watch.

meaning: Behaving, done, or made in a cautious and surreptitious manner, so as not to be seen or heard.
sentence: The cat made a stealthy approach toward the bird.

meaning: Not openly acknowledged or displayed.
sentence: It was a covert military operation.

meaning: Attempting to avoid notice or attention, typically because of guilt or a belief that discovery would lead to trouble.
sentence: He cast a furtive look over his shoulder.

meaning: Existing beyond what is obvious or admitted; intentionally hidden.
sentence: She had an ulterior motive for helping him.

meaning: The disguising of military personnel, equipment, and installations by painting or covering them to make them blend in with their surroundings.
sentence: The soldiers used branches as camouflage.

meaning: A piece of fine material worn by women to protect or conceal the face. Also, something that hides or obscures something.
sentence: A thin veil of mist covered the valley.

meaning: Be or remain hidden so as to wait in ambush for someone or something.
sentence: Danger lurks around every corner.

meaning: Done or shown openly; plainly or readily apparent, not secret or hidden.
sentence: His overt hostility was shocking.

meaning: Legitimate, honest, and open.
sentence: The deal was completely aboveboard.

meaning: Full of twists and turns. Also, excessively lengthy and complex.
sentence: The path to success is often tortuous.

meaning: Having many curves and turns.
sentence: The river followed a sinuous course.

meaning: Extremely small. Also, a unit of time.
sentence: The diagram showed the minute details of the cell.

meaning: The face of a building. Also, an outward appearance that is maintained to conceal a less pleasant reality.
sentence: Behind his cheerful façade, he was very lonely.

meaning: A thin decorative covering of fine wood applied to a coarser wood. Also, a superficial appearance or show.
sentence: His politeness was just a veneer.

meaning: A person's face, with reference to the form or proportions of the features.
sentence: His visage was grim and determined.

meaning: The outer surface or structure of something.
sentence: The exterior of the house needs painting.

meaning: The way that someone or something looks.
sentence: She takes pride in her appearance.

meaning: The outward appearance or apparent form of something, especially when the reality is different.
sentence: She tried to maintain a semblance of order.

meaning: Nearer the front, especially situated in the front of the body or nearer to the head.
sentence: The anterior part of the brain is damaged.

meaning: Further back in position; of or nearer the rear or hind end.
sentence: The posterior legs of the insect are longer.

meaning: (especially of a person) unfortunate.
sentence: The hapless victims were caught in the crossfire.

meaning: Having or marked by bad luck; unlucky.
sentence: It was an unfortunate incident.

meaning: Destined to fail or have bad luck.
sentence: The ill-fated voyage ended in disaster.

meaning: (of a person) wretchedly unhappy or uncomfortable.
sentence: He felt miserable after the breakup.

meaning: (of something bad) experienced or present to the maximum degree. Also, (of a person or their behavior) completely without pride or dignity.
sentence: They lived in abject poverty.

meaning: Characterized by, expressing, or causing sorrow or misery.
sentence: She told a woeful tale of her misfortunes.

meaning: (of a person) in a very unhappy or unfortunate state.
sentence: I felt wretched about what I had done.

meaning: Having special rights, advantages, or immunities.
sentence: She comes from a privileged background.

meaning: Favored by or involving good luck or fortune.
sentence: We are fortunate to have such good friends.

meaning: A situation in which no progress is possible, especially because of disagreement.
sentence: Negotiations have reached an impasse.

meaning: A situation, typically one involving opposing parties, in which no progress can be made.
sentence: The talks ended in a deadlock.

meaning: A situation or condition in which there is no movement or activity at all.
sentence: Traffic came to a complete standstill.

meaning: A situation in which further action or progress by opposing or competing parties seems impossible.
sentence: The war settled into a bloody stalemate.

meaning: Bring or come to an abrupt stop.
sentence: The car screeched to a halt.

meaning: A period of time when the proceedings of a parliament, committee, court of law, or other official body are temporarily suspended.
sentence: The court is in recess for the weekend.

meaning: A deadlock between two equally matched opponents in a dispute or conflict.
sentence: The hostage situation ended in a tense stand-off.

meaning: A sudden, dramatic, and important discovery or development.
sentence: Scientists have made a major breakthrough in cancer research.

meaning: Move forward or make progress, especially when circumstances make this slow or difficult.
sentence: We are making little headway against the strong wind.

meaning: Of vital importance; crucial.
sentence: It is imperative that you see a doctor immediately.

meaning: Required by law or rules; compulsory.
sentence: Attendance at the meeting is mandatory.

meaning: Required by law or a rule; obligatory.
sentence: Education is compulsory until age 16.

meaning: Required by a legal, moral, or other rule; compulsory.
sentence: It is obligatory to wear a seatbelt.

meaning: Necessary for (someone) as a duty or responsibility. Also, currently holding office.
sentence: It is incumbent on us to take action.

meaning: Made necessary by particular circumstances or regulations.
sentence: She lacks the requisite experience for the job.

meaning: Requiring immediate action or attention.
sentence: There is an urgent need for food and water.

meaning: Absolutely necessary.
sentence: His help was indispensable to the project.

meaning: Available to be chosen but not obligatory.
sentence: Attendance at the workshop is optional.

meaning: Available for use at the discretion of the user.
sentence: You have a discretionary budget for the project.

meaning: Done, given, or acting of one's own free will.
sentence: The organization relies on voluntary contributions.

meaning: Done on purpose; deliberate.
sentence: It was an intentional attempt to hurt her.

meaning: (of something regarded as unpleasant) continuing without pause or interruption.
sentence: The incessant noise drove me crazy.

meaning: Without a break in continuity.
sentence: We had three days of uninterrupted sunshine.

meaning: Forming an unbroken whole; without interruption.
sentence: The brain needs a continuous supply of oxygen.

meaning: Never ending or changing.
sentence: He seems to be in a perpetual state of confusion.

meaning: Lasting or existing forever; without end or beginning.
sentence: She promised him eternal love.

meaning: Having or appearing to have no end.
sentence: It seemed like an unending journey.

meaning: Endless (often used hyperbolically).
sentence: The meeting seemed interminable.

meaning: Occurring at irregular intervals or only in a few places; scattered or isolated.
sentence: There were sporadic outbreaks of violence.

meaning: Occurring at irregular intervals; not continuous or steady.
sentence: We had intermittent rain all day.

meaning: Occurring often or repeatedly.
sentence: She suffers from recurrent headaches.

meaning: Appearing or occurring at intervals.
sentence: He makes periodic visits to the doctor.

meaning: (of the weather) unpleasantly cold or wet.
sentence: The game was postponed due to inclement weather.

meaning: (of something bad or undesirable) very great; intense. Also, strict or harsh.
sentence: He suffered severe head injuries.

meaning: Unpleasantly rough or jarring to the senses. Also, cruel or severe.
sentence: The punishment was too harsh.

meaning: Definition pending...
